column4: dmacnutt: its just my personal laptop. besides maybe a private file server, web server, 3 or 4 users, nothing
dual booting with windows vista, will that slow my system up in any way? and do you guys really think i should use a 64 bit arch livecd or just go with 32 bit?
will i get the same performance?
dont want to wipe out vista, and i get unfixable trouble with ubuntu
I use 64bit,  but I would try 32 bit to avoid some problems
did u have a ton of problems?
but SOME things SOMETIMES work a bit worse in 64 bit
in example I guess some java applications
if I would be totall newbie I would go 32b.
im not a total newbie to linux or unix in general, simply with installing a distro with these hardware specs.
i dont mind doing a bit of tweaking, but i want to make sure that its actually possible to get these things working fully
I guess ubuntu would be ok.. but compiz is not perfect
